DOC.brief_summary: The trial aims to assess the value of two-regimen antibiotic prophylaxis versus placebo in elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
DOC.detailed_description: All patients enrolled will be submitted to laparoscopic cholecystectomy. The primary aim of the trial will be to assess the role of prophylactic i.v. infusion of ampicillin-sulbactam, ciprofloxacin, and placebo to reduce the rate of surgical site infection.
DOC.criteria: elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy; patients suffering from gallbladder stones,chronic cholecystitis, cholesterolosis, or gallbladder polyps. acute cholecystitis; acute cholangitis; acute pancreatitis; pregnant or lactating women; antibiotic allergy; antibiotic therapy within 48 hours to 7 days prior to surgery; clinically active infection at the moment of surgery; evidence of common bile duct stones; contraindications for laparoscopic cholecystectomy; no other additional procedure; indication of obligatory antibiotic prophylaxis because the medical condition was different from biliary disease (immunosuppression, corticoid use, etc). patients unable to give informed consent.
